content:
Certainly! Here is the Wolfram Language code (used in Mathematica) that I used to generate the table of planet densities along with images of each planet:
```wolfram
planetData = EntityValue[EntityClass["Planet", All], {"Name", "Density", "Image"}];
planetTable = TableForm[planetData, TableHeadings -> {None, {"Planet", "Density (kg/m^3)", "Image"}}];
planetTable
```
This code retrieves data for all planets in our solar system using the `EntityValue` function with the `EntityClass` of "Planet". It then extracts the "Name", "Density", and "Image" properties for each planet. The data is then formatted into a table using the `TableForm` function, with headings for "Planet", "Density (kg/m^3)", and "Image". The resulting table is stored in the variable `planetTable` and is displayed as the output.
